Detailed Description

template<class TKey, class TValue>
class SimpleMap< TKey, TValue >

Template class SimpleMap provides a trivially implemented associative array. An associative array is an array whose values can be referenced by passing a key-value which is not restricted to an integral data type. Look at the following sample function:

static void UsaAgeMap()
{
    SimpleMap<WString, INT> age_map;

    // Add two new entries for keys "Fred" and "Thomas". Since the keys don't
    // exist they are created first. Since on creation an out of memory error
    // may occur, we have to check this.
    age_map["Fred"] = 31;
    if (!age_map.Ok()) {
        // Out of memory.
        return;
    }
    age_map["Thomas"] = 35;
    if (!age_map.Ok()) {
        // Out of memory.
        return;
    }

    // Overwrite an existing key's value.
    age_map["Fred"] = 32;

    // Access the elements at existing keys.
    INT age;
    age = age_map["Fred"];
    age = age_map["Thomas"];

    // If a key does not exist, a default initialized element is created first
    // and then the default value is returned. The following line inserts key
    // "John" with default value 0 and returns this default value. Since on
    // creation an out of memory error may occur, we have to check this.
    age = age_map["John"];
    if (!age_map.Ok()) {
        // Out of memory.
        return;
    }

    // Check if some key already exists.
    if (!age_map.Exists("Hugo")) {
        age_map["Hugo"] = 33;
        if (!age_map.Ok()) {
            // Out of memory.
            return;
        }
    }

    // Remove an element.
    if (age_map.Remove("Fred")) {
        // Element existed.
    }
    else {
        // Element didn't exist.
    }

    // Get the number of key-value pairs.
    const UINT size = age_map.GetSize();
}

TKey and TValue may be of any type. The subscript operator returns the value associated with a key gathered by a simple linear search through the list of nodes. If the non-const subscript operator has been applied and the key does not exist, then a default initialized entry with that key is first created and then returned. If an out of memory error occurs, an internal error flag is set which can be checked using method Ok(). If the const subscript operator has been applied and the key does not exist, then this is considered an error condition and an internal error flag is set which can be checked using method Ok(). In any case, method Ok() has to be called after any subscript operator has been applied to check if the operation succeeded.

Member Typedef Documentation

Member Function Documentation

template<class TKey, class TValue>
BOOLEAN SimpleMap< TKey, TValue >::Ok (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the last access using a subscript operator or GetValue() was successful. If the last access was not successful, then

  • in case of prior application of the non-const subscript operator an out of memory error occurred, or
  • in case of prior application of the const subscript operator or method GetValue() the element tried to access was not part of the associative array.
